Darwin was also very interested in

geology and he attended a course

taught by the authority on geology,

Dr. Robert Jameson.

Now… what we saw

outside was, that…

almond-shaped molten rock and…

Yawn…

Professor

Jameson’s

lectures are

so boring.

But the Professor’s geology museum is

really cool!

Professor Jameson was in charge

of the museum geological specimens and Darwin spent much time there stuffing birds for display.

Wow! Did you

stuff all the birds in

the museum? You should

try dissection with

the same zeal.

Hmm, I think

I’d rather stuff off that mouth!

In April of 1827, Darwin left

Edinburgh University after only two years and without earning a degree.


33
